title: ICD10分类
text: classify_icd10 该函数把人群肿瘤登记数据的icd10编码转化为肿瘤分类的因子。目前可以实现如下功能: 按照不同的分类方式进行分类。 输出为不同的语言(简体中文和英语)。

title: ICD10分类
code: library(canregtools) file <- system.file("extdata", "411721.xls", package = "canregtools") data <- read_canreg(file) #> 2200  cases were read from FB sheet.1470  cases were read from SW sheet. icd10 <- sample(data$FBcases$icd10, 20) icd10 #>  [1] "C73"   "C15.9" "C25.9" "C54.1" "C64"   "C34.9" "C34.8" "C67.9" "C34.1" #> [10] "C34.9" "C50.9" "C34.9" "C80"   "C20"   "C16.3" "C20"   "C34.9" "C95.0" #> [19] "C34.9" "C15.9" ## 把icd10按照疾病系统进行分类，并输出为中文 cate1 <- classify_icd10(icd10, type = "system", lang = "cn") cate1 #>  [1] 眼、脑、甲状腺 消化系统       消化系统       女性生殖系统   泌尿系统       #>  [6] 呼吸系统       呼吸系统       泌尿系统       呼吸系统       呼吸系统       #> [11] 乳腺癌         呼吸系统       其他           消化系统       消化系统       #> [16] 消化系统       呼吸系统       造血系统       呼吸系统       消化系统       #> 12 Levels: 排除 唇口咽 消化系统 呼吸系统 骨、软骨、皮肤 乳腺癌 ... 其他  ## 把icd10按照疾病大类进行分类，并输出为英文 cate2 <- classify_icd10(icd10, type = "big", lang = "en") cate2 #>  [1] Thyroid      Esophagus    Pancreas     Uterus       Kidney       #>  [6] Lung         Lung         Bladder      Lung         Lung         #> [11] Breast       Lung         Other        Colon-rectum Stomach      #> [16] Colon-rectum Lung         Leukemia     Lung         Esophagus    #> 27 Levels: Excluded Oral cavity & pharynx Nasopharynx Esophagus ... Other  ## 把icd10按照疾病小类进行分类，并输出为中文 cate3 <- classify_icd10(icd10, type = "small", lang = "cn") cate3 #>  [1] 甲状腺           食管             胰腺             子宫体           #>  [5] 肾               气管、支气管、肺 气管、支气管、肺 膀胱             #>  [9] 气管、支气管、肺 气管、支气管、肺 乳腺             气管、支气管、肺 #> [13] 其他或未指明部位 直肠             胃               直肠             #> [17] 气管、支气管、肺 白血病,未特指    气管、支气管、肺 食管             #> 60 Levels: 排除 唇 舌 口 唾液腺 扁桃腺 其他口咽 鼻咽 下咽 咽,部位不明 ... 其他或未指明部位

title: Authors and Citation
text: Qiong Chen. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Chen Q (2023). canregtools: Analysis Data PBCR (Population-Based Cancer Registration,PBCR). R package version 0.2.6, https://gigu003.github.io/canregtools/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {canregtools: Analysis Data from PBCR (Population-Based Cancer Registration,PBCR)},   author = {Qiong Chen},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.2.6},   url = {https://gigu003.github.io/canregtools/}, }

what: Analysis Data from PBCR (Population-Based Cancer Registration,PBCR)
title: Analysis Data from PBCR (Population-Based Cancer Registration,PBCR)
text: 肿瘤登记是恶性肿瘤监测的一项常规工作，它在人群中搜集、整理和统计分析肿瘤发病、死亡及生存资料，从而为肿瘤防控提供基础数据。canregtools包致力于为肿瘤登记工作提供数据逻辑核查、数据分析、可视化、和肿瘤登记报告等常用的功能和函数。

title: Analysis Data from PBCR (Population-Based Cancer Registration,PBCR)
text: 目前该包还没有放到CRAN上，但是可以通过GitHub来安装开发版本的canregtools，具体方法如下： 或者
code: ## 安装devtools包 install.packages("devtools")  ## 利用devtools包安装存放在github上的canregtools devtools::install_github("gigu003/canregtools") ## 安装remotes包 install.packages("remotes")  library(remotes) install_github("gigu003/canregtools")

what: Calculate the age standardized rate using the direct method. — ageadjust
title: Calculate the age standardized rate using the direct method. — ageadjust
text: Calculate age standardized rate using direct method.

title: Calculate the age standardized rate using the direct method. — ageadjust
code: ageadjust(   count,   pop,   rate = NULL,   stdpop,   method = "gamma",   conf_level = 0.95,   mp = 1e+05 )

title: Calculate the age standardized rate using the direct method. — ageadjust
text: count number cases specific disease condition. pop total population group region disease cases (count) observed. rate Disease rate, number cases (count) per unit population (pop). stdpop Standardized population age standardization. method Method used calculating age-standardized rate, options 'gamma', 'normal', 'lognormal', default 'gamma'. conf_level Confidence level calculating confidence intervals, value 0 1, default 0.95. mp multiplier used scale calculated rates. Default 100000.

title: Calculate the age standardized rate using the direct method. — ageadjust
text: Age standardized rate confidence interval.

title: Calculate the age standardized rate using the direct method. — ageadjust

what: Compute age standardized rate based on provided standard population — asr_rate
title: Compute age standardized rate based on provided standard population — asr_rate
text: function compute crude rate age standard rates 95% confidence intervals(CIs).

title: Compute age standardized rate based on provided standard population — asr_rate
code: asr_rate(   data,   ...,   method = "gamma",   event = fbs,   pop = rks,   agegrp = "agegrp",   std = c("segi", "china"),   mp = 1e+05,   sig = 0.95,   decimal = 2,   show_var = FALSE,   type = "big",   lang = "cn" )

title: Compute age standardized rate based on provided standard population — asr_rate
text: data data frame tibble containing case counts, population risk, stratification variables calculating standardized rates. ... Variable variables stratification compute age standard rates. method parameter specifies method used calculate confidence intervals rates. options "gamma" (default), "normal", "lognormal". Different methods may produce slightly different confidence intervals. event variable within input data corresponds cases counts. pop variable within input data corresponds population risk stratification. agegrp variable within input data corresponds age categories. std Specify standard population structure 'std_pop' data frame used calculating standardized rates. calculating standardized rates multiple standard populations, specify std = c("segi", "china"). mp constant multiply rates (e.g. mp=1000 rates per 1000). sig desired level confidence computing confidence intervals. default 0.95 95 percent CIs. decimal parameter specifies number decimal places round results. default 2, means rates rounded two decimal places. show_var Logical value whether show variance . type Character, regrouping type cancers, options 'system', 'big', 'small', default 'big'. lang Character, language output, options 'en' 'cn'. Default 'cn'.

title: Compute age standardized rate based on provided standard population — asr_rate
text: data frame tibble contains age standard rates CIs. Variables included output data frame follows. ... Variable variables stratification. no_cases Sum cases stratification. cr Crude rate stratification. cr_var Variance crude rate. cr_lower Lower limit crude rate confidence interval. cr_upper Upper limit crude rate confidence interval. asr_china Age standardized rate using china standard pop. output variable name "asr_" followed name standard population, standard population used. asr_var_china Variance age standard rate using china standard population. asr_lower_china Lower limit age standard rate confidence interval using china standard population. asr_upper_china Upper limit age standard rate confidence interval using china standard population.

title: Compute age standardized rate based on provided standard population — asr_rate
text: Fay MP, Feuer EJ (1997). “Confidence Intervals Directly Standardized Rates: Method Based Gamma Distribution.” Stat Med, 16(7), 791--801. ISSN 0277-6715, http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9131766.

title: Compute age standardized rate based on provided standard population — asr_rate
text: Qiong Chen

what: Check if the Chinese ID number complies with the GB 11643-1999 standard. — check_id
title: Check if the Chinese ID number complies with the GB 11643-1999 standard. — check_id
text: Check Chinese ID number complies GB 11643-1999 standard.

title: Check if the Chinese ID number complies with the GB 11643-1999 standard. — check_id
Check if the Chinese ID number complies with the GB 11643-1999 standard. — check_id
text: x character vector containing Chinese ID numbers checked compliance GB 11643-1999 standard. return character string used specific type result returned. Options 'logical', 'date', 'areacode', 'formatted'. Options include: 'logical': Logical vector (default). Indicates whether input ID number complies standard (TRUE compliant, FALSE non-compliant). 'date': Date vector representing birth date contained ID number. 'areacode': Character vector containing administrative region codes extracted ID number. 'formatted': Character vector containing formatted ID numbers.

title: Check if the Chinese ID number complies with the GB 11643-1999 standard. — check_id
text: logical vector indicating whether input ID number complies standard (TRUE compliant, FALSE non-compliant), types information based 'return' parameter.

title: Check if the Chinese ID number complies with the GB 11643-1999 standard. — check_id

what: Classify the Childhood cancer into ICCC3 — classify_childhood
title: Classify the Childhood cancer into ICCC3 — classify_childhood
text: Classify Childhood cancer ICCC3

title: Classify the Childhood cancer into ICCC3 — classify_childhood
Classify the Childhood cancer into ICCC3 — classify_childhood
text: topo Topography parts ICDO3 codes format 'C15.6' 'C156'. morp Morphology parts ICDO3 codes format '8000' 'M8140'. type Type Classification output, options 'main' 'sub', default 'main'. lang Language output, options 'cn' 'en', default 'cn'.

title: Classify the Childhood cancer into ICCC3 — classify_childhood
text: Factor ICCC3 classification childhood cancer.

title: Classify the Childhood cancer into ICCC3 — classify_childhood
text: function classify 'topo' 'morp' parts ICDO3 codes ICCC3 (International Classification Childhood Cancer, Third edition).

title: Classify the Childhood cancer into ICCC3 — classify_childhood
code: library(canregtools) file <- system.file("extdata", "411721.xls", package = "canregtools") data <- read_canreg(file) #> 2200  cases were read from FB sheet.1470  cases were read from SW sheet. fbcases <- data$FBcases fbcases <- fbcases[fbcases$age <= 14,] classify_childhood(fbcases$topo, fbcases$morp, lang = "cn") #> [1] XII. 其他和未特指          未分类或原位癌;            #> [3] V. 视网膜母细胞瘤          XI. 其他恶性上皮和黑色素瘤 #> [5] XII. 其他和未特指          II. 淋巴瘤                 #> 13 Levels: I. 白血病 II. 淋巴瘤 III. 中枢神经系统 ... 未分类或原位癌; classify_childhood(fbcases$topo, fbcases$morp, lang = "en") #> [1] XII. Other & unspecified         Not Classified or in situ        #> [3] V. Retinoblastoma                XI. Other epithelial & melanomas #> [5] XII. Other & unspecified         II. Lymphomas & ralated          #> 13 Levels: I. Leukemias, MPD, & MDS II. Lymphomas & ralated ... Not Classified or in situ classify_childhood(fbcases$topo, fbcases$morp, type = "sub", lang = "cn") #> [1] XIIb. 其他未指定的恶性肿瘤               #> [2] 不被ICCC分类或原位癌                     #> [3] V. 视网膜母细胞瘤                        #> [4] XIb. 甲状腺癌                            #> [5] XIIb. 其他未指定的恶性肿瘤               #> [6] IIb. 非霍奇金淋巴瘤（除外Burkitt淋巴瘤） #> 49 Levels: Ia. 淋巴白血病 Ib. 急性髓系白血病 ... 不被ICCC分类或原位癌 classify_childhood(fbcases$topo, fbcases$morp, type = "sub", lang = "en") #> [1] XIIb. Other unspecified malignant tumors #> [2] Not Classified by ICCC or in situ        #> [3] V. Retinoblastoma                        #> [4] XIb. thyroid carcinomas                  #> [5] XIIb. Other unspecified malignant tumors #> [6] IIb. Non-Hodgkin except BL               #> 49 Levels: Ia. Lymphod leukemias Ib. Acute myeloid Ic. CMD ... Not Classified by ICCC or in situ

what: Convert ICD10 Codes to Cancer Categories. — classify_icd10
title: Convert ICD10 Codes to Cancer Categories. — classify_icd10
text: Convert ICD10 codes Cancer Categories according specified category type language.

title: Convert ICD10 Codes to Cancer Categories. — classify_icd10
Convert ICD10 Codes to Cancer Categories. — classify_icd10
text: icd10 ICD10 codes cancer part (C00-C98 D00-D48) collected Population-Based Cancer Registration (PBCR). type Character, type cancer category ("system","big","small"), default, "big" category choosed categorize icd10 code 25 cancer categories. lang Character, two options ("cn","en"), default, lang="cn" choosed, output categories Chinese, otherwise, English.

title: Convert ICD10 Codes to Cancer Categories. — classify_icd10
text: vector contain cancer categories.

title: Convert ICD10 Codes to Cancer Categories. — classify_icd10
text: National Cancer Center. Guidelines Cancer Registration China (2016) [M]. Beijing: People's Medical Publishing House, 2016.

title: Convert ICD10 Codes to Cancer Categories. — classify_icd10
text: Qiong Chen, Email: chenqiong@hnccr.org.cn

title: Convert ICD10 Codes to Cancer Categories. — classify_icd10
code: library(canregtools) icd10 <- c("C16.1", "C15.1", "C34.1", "C34.2", "C15.0") category <- classify_icd10(icd10, type = "system", lang = "en")

text: Clean canreg data.

title: Clean canreg data. — clean_canreg
code: clean_canreg(   x,   cutage_method = "distance",   smooth_age = "natural",   breaks = c(0, 15, 40, 65),   length = 5,   maxage = 85,   sep_zero = TRUE,   labels = NULL,   label_tail = NULL,   type = "big",   lang = "cn" )

title: Clean canreg data. — clean_canreg
text: x Data class 'canreg'. cutage_method Method grouping ages. Options 'distance', 'interval', 'quarter'. Default 'distance'. smooth_age Method expanding age. Options 'linear','natural', 'periodic'. Default 'natural'. breaks Cut points age groups 'cutage_method' 'interval'. Default 'c(0, 15, 40, 65)'. length Length age group 'cutage_method' 'distance'. Default 5. maxage Start age last age groups. Default 85. sep_zero Logical value TRUE FALSE, 0-year age group treated separate group. Default TRUE. labels Labels age groups. label_tail Tail labels. type Specify grouping method tumors. Options 'system', 'big', 'small'. Default 'big'. lang Specify language output. Options 'en' 'cn'. Default 'cn'.

title: Count the canreg data. — count_canreg
text: Count canreg data.

title: Count the canreg data. — count_canreg
code: count_canreg(   x,   cutage_method = "distance",   smooth_age = "natural",   breaks = c(0, 15, 40, 65),   length = 5,   maxage = 85,   sep_zero = TRUE,   labels = NULL,   label_tail = NULL,   type = "big",   lang = "cn" )

title: Count the canreg data. — count_canreg
text: x Object data class 'canreg'. cutage_method Methods Specifying Age Groups. Options "interval", "distance", "quantile". Default "distance". smooth_age Methods expanding age groups 5 years 1 year. breaks Specicify break points classify age groups cutage_method 'interval'. Default 'c(0, 15, 40, 65)'. length Specify length age group cutage_method 'distance'. Default 5. maxage Specify max age age group cutage_method 'distance'. Default 85. sep_zero Logical value, TRUE FALSE, specifying whether treat age 0 separate group. Default TRUE. labels Labels age groups. Default NULL. label_tail Tail label added labels. Default NULL. type Method classify cancer sites. lang Character value specify language used. options 'cn' Chinese, 'en' English.

title: Count the canreg data. — count_canreg
text: object 'fbswicd'.

title: Count the canreg data. — count_canreg
code: library(canregtools) file <- system.file("extdata", "411721.xls", package = "canregtools") data <- read_canreg(file) #> 2200  cases were read from FB sheet.1470  cases were read from SW sheet. fbsw <- count_canreg(data, cutage_method = "interval") #> [1] "Processing data: 2200 FBcases." #> [1] "Processing data: 1470 SWcases." #> [1] "Processing POP data of year: 2016" #> Warning: There were 3 warnings in `mutate()`. #> The first warning was: #> ℹ In argument: `sex = (structure(function (..., .x = ..1, .y = ..2, . = ..1) #>   ...`. #> Caused by warning in `[<-.factor`: #> ! invalid factor level, NA generated #> ℹ Run `dplyr::last_dplyr_warnings()` to see the 2 remaining warnings. fbsw #> $areacode #> [1] "411721" #>  #> $county #> [1] "" #>  #> $area_type #> [1] "Rural" #>  #> $location #> [1] "" #>  #> $year #> [1] 2016 #>  #> $fbswicd #> # A tibble: 208 × 11 #>     year sex   agegrp   icd_cat   fbs   sws    mv    ub   sub   dco    rks #>    <dbl> <fct> <fct>    <fct>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1  2016 男性  0-14 岁  口腔        0     0     0     0     0     0  80846 #>  2  2016 男性  15-39 岁 口腔        1     0     1     0     1     0 180929 #>  3  2016 男性  40-64 岁 口腔        5     2     5     0     3     0 155155 #>  4  2016 男性  65+ 岁   口腔        7     8     7     0     3     0  38723 #>  5  2016 男性  0-14 岁  鼻咽        0     0     0     0     0     0  80846 #>  6  2016 男性  15-39 岁 鼻咽        2     0     2     0     2     0 180929 #>  7  2016 男性  40-64 岁 鼻咽        2     6     2     0     2     0 155155 #>  8  2016 男性  65+ 岁   鼻咽        3     1     3     0     3     0  38723 #>  9  2016 男性  0-14 岁  食管        0     0     0     0     0     0  80846 #> 10  2016 男性  15-39 岁 食管        1     0     1     0     0     0 180929 #> # ℹ 198 more rows #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "fbswicd" "list"

code: library(canregtools) file <- system.file("extdata", "411721.xls", package = "canregtools") data <- read_canreg(file) #> 2200  cases were read from FB sheet.1470  cases were read from SW sheet. fbsw <- count_canreg(data, cutage_method = "interval") #> [1] "Processing data: 2200 FBcases." #> [1] "Processing data: 1470 SWcases." #> [1] "Processing POP data of year: 2016" #> Warning: There were 3 warnings in `mutate()`. #> The first warning was: #> ℹ In argument: `sex = (structure(function (..., .x = ..1, .y = ..2, . = ..1) #>   ...`. #> Caused by warning in `[<-.factor`: #> ! invalid factor level, NA generated #> ℹ Run `dplyr::last_dplyr_warnings()` to see the 2 remaining warnings. quality <- create_quality(fbsw, year, sex, icd_cat)

title: Cut age into groups. — cutage

title: Cut age into groups. — cutage
code: cutage(   x,   method = "distance",   length = 5,   maxage = 85,   sep_zero = TRUE,   breaks = c(seq(0, 85, 5)),   labels = NULL,   lang = "cn",   label_tail = NULL,   right = FALSE )

title: Cut age into groups. — cutage
text: x Vector contains ages. method method use age grouping. Options "interval", "distance", "quantile". length length intervals age grouping method set "distance". maxage maximum age age grouping. sep_zero logical value indicating whether include separate group age 0. breaks Custom breakpoints "interval" method. labels labels levels resulting category. default, labels constructed using "(,b]" interval notation. labels = FALSE, simple integer codes returned instead factor. lang Language used output. Options 'cn' 'en'. Default 'cn.'. label_tail string appended end label. right logical value indicating whether intervals right-closed right-open.

title: Plot dual bar chart. — dulbar_chart
text: data data frame. topn Top n values show. gap width center gap. Default 0.1. space Space bars. adj vertical adjustment factor labels age classes. Default -0.01. csize font size write labels sides. Default 1. gl Logical value draw vertical dotted lines. Default TRUE. label Labels two sides. legend Legends bars. cols colors bars. dens density hatching lines (/inch). main main title dulbar. ... options.

text: dulbar chart.

title: Plot dual bar chart. — dulbar_chart
code: library(canregtools) file <- system.file("extdata", "411721.xls", package = "canregtools") data <- read_canreg(file) #> 2200  cases were read from FB sheet.1470  cases were read from SW sheet. rate <- asr_rate(data, icd_cat, event = sws) #> [1] "Processing data: 2200 FBcases." #> [1] "Processing data: 1470 SWcases." #> [1] "Processing POP data of year: 2016" #> Warning: There were 3 warnings in `mutate()`. #> The first warning was: #> ℹ In argument: `sex = (structure(function (..., .x = ..1, .y = ..2, . = ..1) #>   ...`. #> Caused by warning in `[<-.factor`: #> ! invalid factor level, NA generated #> ℹ Run `dplyr::last_dplyr_warnings()` to see the 2 remaining warnings. dulbar_chart(rate[,c(1, 3, 6, 9, 10)])

what: Convert ICDO3 codes to ICD10 code. — icdo3to10
title: Convert ICDO3 codes to ICD10 code. — icdo3to10
text: Convert ICDO3 codes ICD10 code based Topography, Morphology, Behavior value.

title: Convert ICDO3 codes to ICD10 code. — icdo3to10
Convert ICDO3 codes to ICD10 code. — icdo3to10
text: topo vector containing ICDO3 topography codes, can format either "C15.1" "C151". morp vector containing ICDO3 morphology codes, format "M8170" "8170". beha vector containing ICDO3 behavior codes, one values c("0", "1", "2", "3", "6").

title: Convert ICDO3 codes to ICD10 code. — icdo3to10
text: vector containing ICD10 code.

title: Convert ICDO3 codes to ICD10 code. — icdo3to10
text: ICD-O-3 (International Classification Diseases Oncology, 3rd Edition) ICD-10 (International Classification Diseases, 10th Edition) two different coding systems used disease classification. ICD-10 widely used coding system can describe various diseases, including tumor diseases. hand, ICD-O-3 specifically designed coding tumor diseases. Promoting using ICD-O-3 ICD-10 helps standardizing unifying classification coding tumor, facilitating global tumor epidemiology research, statistical analysis, clinical management. ICD-O-3 consists three main components: Topography, Morphology, Behavior. Topography code uses four-digit number describe specific location tumor occurs. Morphology code uses three-digit number represent morphology histology type tumor. Behavior code describes behavior characteristics tumor. program, can convert ICD-O-3 codes ICD-10 codes, making convenient research clinical practice.

title: Convert ICDO3 codes to ICD10 code. — icdo3to10

title: Plot line chart — line_chart
text: data input data frame. x_var variable x-axis. y_var variable y-axis. group_var variable used group data multiple lines. y_axis Optional. custom Y-axis tick values. provided, function generates . x_axis Optional. custom X-axis tick values. provided, function generates . col Optional. colors lines. provided, function uses default colors. main Optional. title plot. ... parameters.

text: Line plot.

title: Plot line chart — line_chart
code: library(canregtools) file <- system.file("extdata", "411721.xls", package = "canregtools") data <- read_canreg(file) #> 2200  cases were read from FB sheet.1470  cases were read from SW sheet. fbsw <- count_canreg(data) #> [1] "Processing data: 2200 FBcases." #> [1] "Processing data: 1470 SWcases." #> [1] "Processing POP data of year: 2016" #> Warning: There were 3 warnings in `mutate()`. #> The first warning was: #> ℹ In argument: `sex = (structure(function (..., .x = ..1, .y = ..2, . = ..1) #>   ...`. #> Caused by warning in `[<-.factor`: #> ! invalid factor level, NA generated #> ℹ Run `dplyr::last_dplyr_warnings()` to see the 2 remaining warnings. age <- create_age_rate(fbsw, sex) line_chart(age, agegrp, rate, sex)

Calculate life table from mortality rates. — lt
text: mx Death rate age x. sage Start age. agegrp Age groups width. sex Gender life table, "male","female" "total".

title: Calculate life table from mortality rates. — lt
text: data frame containing following values. age Start age age group. mx Death rate age x. qx probability individual exact age x die exact age x+1. lx Number survivors exact age x. radix 1. dx number deaths exact age x x+1. Lx Number years lived age x x+1. Tx Number years lived exact age x. ex Remaining life expectancy exact age x.

Plot population pyramid — pyramid
text: Plot population pyramid

title: Plot population pyramid — pyramid
code: pyramid(   data,   show_value = TRUE,   show_prop = TRUE,   left_axis = NULL,   right_axis = NULL,   axis_fm = "g",   axis_bm = "",   axis_bi = 3,   cgap = 0.3,   cstep = 1,   csize = 1,   labs = c("Males", "Ages", "Females"),   gl = TRUE,   cadj = 0,   cols = c("#006400", "#b32134"),   dens = c(-1, -1),   main = "",   ... )

title: Plot population pyramid — pyramid
text: data data.frame including left pyramid numbers 1st column right pyramid numbers 2nd column, numbers males age-class usually given left numbers females right numbers. data.frame includes 3rd column, used age-class labels, otherwise row.names(data) used age-class labels. show_value Logical value draw population numbers. Default TRUE. show_prop Logical value draw pyramid using proportion. Default TRUE. left_axis vector axis left pyramid. missing, automatically given using pretty(). right_axis vector axis right pyramid. missing, left_axis used. axis_fm format code formatC plotting axis. missing, "g" used. axis_bm big.mark formatC plotting axis. missing, none. axis_bi big.interval number formatC plotting axis. Default 3. cgap width center gap (ratio panel) draw age-class. Default 0.3. cstep interval write labels age classes. Default 1. csize font size factor write labels age classes. Default 1. labs label left, center, right pyramid. Default c("Males", "Ages", "Females"). gl Logical value draw vertical dotted lines. Default TRUE. cadj vertical adjustment factor labels age classes. Default -0.03. cols color left right pyramid. Default c("lightblue", "pink"). dens density hatching lines (/inch) left right pyramid. Default c(-1, -1), pyramid filled. main main title pyramid. ... options.

title: Plot population pyramid — pyramid
text: population pyramid plot.

title: Plot population pyramid — pyramid
